name: Checkbox

props.name: name
props.description:
Field name used for FormControl binding and form submission. When `bindForm` is false,
`name` may be omitted and no form binding/submission occurs.

props.name: bindForm
props.description: Disable FormControl binding and omit name from submission.

props.name: size
props.description: Visual size; token or CSS length.

props.name: indeterminate
props.description: Mixed (indeterminate) visual state for parent selections.

props.name: label
props.description: Visual label rendered by the component or its wrapper. Accepts string or node.

props.name: helperText
props.description: Supplemental hint or validation content typically rendered under the control.

props.name: error
props.description: Marks the field invalid; components may adjust visuals and helper text color.

props.name: fullWidth
props.description: Stretches the field wrapper to occupy the full available width.

props.name: preset
props.description: One or many style-preset names registered via `definePreset()`

bestPractices: Use Checkbox for independent booleans. For mutually exclusive choices, prefer `RadioGroup` .
Always provide a clear label. The entire label should be clickable. In forms, set a stable `name` so values submit predictably.
Choose control model deliberately. Use `checked` / `onChange` when the value participates in app state; otherwise `defaultChecked` is fine for local forms.
Keep targets comfortable. Pick `size` tokens or numeric sizes that keep tap areas ≥ 40–48px in dense UIs.
Group with a visible question or caption when multiple checkboxes relate to one concept; don’t rely on proximity alone.
Disabled with context. If a checkbox is disabled, explain why nearby; avoid silently disabling without guidance.
Tokens/presets. Style with theme tokens and `preset` rather than ad‑hoc CSS to keep density and branding consistent.
